group.label: General Configuration for OWL Product Carousels and Banner Sliders

field.label: Breakpoint 1
field.comment: Add breakpoint. Ex.: 320. Applied to resolutions higher than set value.

field.label: Breakpoint 2
field.comment: Add breakpoint. Ex.: 768. Applied to resolutions higher than set value.

field.label: Breakpoint 3
field.comment: Add breakpoint. Ex.: 1024. Applied to resolutions higher than set value.

field.label: Breakpoint 4
field.comment: Add breakpoint. Ex.: 1280. Applied to resolutions higher than set value.

field.label: Enable Carousel
field.comment: In order for carousel to be displayed, make sure you have products defined as "New" and the carousel is inserted in your page/block. Insert the carousel by following the documentation.

field.label: Title
field.comment: Visible only if not empty.

field.label: Max Items
field.comment: The number of items you want to load.

field.label: Next/Prev Buttons
field.comment: If True, next/prev buttons are displayed. Carousel Breakpoint options overwrites this option. Please check below Breakpoint Carousel Options.

field.label: Dots
field.comment: If True, dots navigation are displayed.

field.label: Center
field.comment: If True, carousel is centered on the screen. Works well even with an odd number of items. Carousel Breakpoint options overwrites this option. Please check below Breakpoint Carousel Options.

field.label: StagePadding
field.comment: Padding left and right on stage (can see neighbours). Carousel Breakpoint options overwrites this option. Please check below Breakpoint Carousel Options .

field.label: Items
field.comment: The number of items you want to see on the screen. This value should be smaller than Max Items. Carousel Breakpoint options overwrites this option. Please check below Breakpoint Carousel Options.

field.label: Loop
field.comment: Inifnity loop. Duplicate last and first items to get loop illusion.

field.label: Margin
field.comment: Set right margin for each item in carousel. Example: for a margin of 30px enter 30 in the field.

field.label: LazyLoad
field.comment: Lazy Load delays loading of images. Images outside of viewport are not loaded until user scrolls to them.

field.label: AutoplayTimeout
field.comment: Autoplay interval timeout.

field.label: AutoplayHoverPause
field.comment: Pause on mouse hover.
